name: Kepler-368
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-368 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-368 is a star with 2.6 times the mass of the Sun, and 2.02 times its radius. It is located 2571.09 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-368 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-368 b

Kepler-368 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 26.85 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-368.

The mass of Kepler-368 b is 16.43 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-368 b is 3.26 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-368 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-368 c

Kepler-368 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 72.38 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-368.

The mass of Kepler-368 c is 24.89 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-368 c is 3.88 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-368 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-368, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
